website_summaries.verdict: These natural odor-neutralizing granules are a top choice for cats and pet parents who are sensitive to fragrances.
pros: Zeolite granules with a patented coating
Completely eliminate odors rather than simply masking them
Highly concentrated formula tackles even the most pungent litter box odors
Safe to use around children and pets
cons: Patented coating has a bleach-like smell, but it does clear up after a few minutes

customer_reviews.title: I work hard so my cats can have a better life ;)
customer_reviews.text: Has a bleach smell...I'm into it. The smell is strong but it cuts the other odors...I use and run away...and try to keep cats away too. After you sprinkle there is dust, so...idk if the dust is toxic or not. I would buy again but I will always sprinkle and run. After an hour or so the bleach smell mellows and no odor is noticeable. Buy it, try it, don't breathe it. Solid purchase...unless I get pneumonia or sinus infection ;) I'll update if respitory struggles ensue. If you don't hear back buy the shiz outta this stuff or call the po lice about a cat lady who stopped breathing and is being eaten by her cats. Either way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective... Yes! Pricey...Yes! Options...YES!
customer_reviews.text: The NonScents Odor Control is legit and effective. Only problem is the price. I bought one bag then realized I was overpaying for nice packaging. The exact ingredients can be purchased wholesale in bulk for much less $$$. Just sayin'
customer_reviews.author: Bshops2much!

customer_reviews.title: You will need it
customer_reviews.text: Great product! No more face masks, I think my cats like it too, it doesn't have a artificial scent
customer_reviews.author: yi shi

customer_reviews.title: Scary drying and dusty....bad for respiratory system and for skin!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last minute because I had to be away for a few weeks. I thought it might help my neighbor who came to look after my kitties. It's kinda like clay but with even more SCARY DRYING EFFECT and DUSTY. I felt it in my NOSE and THROAT and EYES. IT WAS HORRIBLE...AWFUL! The description says natural but it has a chemical/chlorine odor to it, like cheap clay full of chemicals. One of my kitties had a bad skin allergy reaction to it. Poor poor thing, it took a while for his wounds to heal. BUYERS BEWARE!!! Just stick with a good natural biodegradable litter. No need for this kind of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sainte Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t noticed any impact to the cat litter smell other than a bleachy type odor from the product itself. I’m going back to Nature’s Miracle cat litter deodorizer which I’ve been using for years. No idea why there are so many positive reviews of this product. Doesn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Melodie's Corner

customer_reviews.title: Smells like moth balls and doesn't really work well
customer_reviews.text: Smells like moth balls and doesn't really work well. It has a very kitty litter like texture, which is strange and it causes a ton of dust to get kicked up. I'm concerned that this could be bad for my cats respiratory health.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: works but has lots of side effects
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews and also it took me awhile to write this one. This thing does work but you have to put a lot. I only used it 3 times and it was over. Also this thing has a lot of dust particles which is bad for your cat and my cat started sneezing a lot after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Javz

customer_reviews.title: Works great but one of my cats hates the smell
customer_reviews.text: I would not characterize this as scent-free. As others have mentioned, it does have a smell a little like bleach. I'm okay with that smell; one of my cats not so much. I have a top-entry litter box (clever cat) and i think the cover traps that bleachy smell. Anyway one of my two cats hated it and made a protest "deposit" on the rug. Because of kitty omerta, they aren't saying which one did it. Now i sprinkle on a very small amount and rake a light layer of litter over the sprinkles. So far, no more carpet poops and it really does control the odor.
customer_reviews.author: Austinite

customer_reviews.title: Almost re-homed her kitty!
customer_reviews.text: We like this product. We’re a family of canines. My new adult daughter needed a feline. We, for many years refused to allow her to have a indoor kitty because of indoor cat litter odors. Once Evie (Turkish Angora feline) turned 6 months old her litter began to smell terrible.....not just in her room but in our entire home. I would clean the litter box daily. I would replace the litter weekly. I finally google search “smelly cat box” and somehow came across this product. Totally eliminated the odors that almost caused us to re-home her sweet Evie.
customer_reviews.author: qtfamily

customer_reviews.title: A sprinkle a day keeps the odor away
customer_reviews.text: A sprinkle a day keeps the odor away....unfortunately I have a kitty that won’t do number #2 in his box if there isn’t a scent & as soon as I stopped using this product he started using his litter box again. Sigh! He can be challenging but I adore him!
customer_reviews.author: JLN

customer_reviews.title: Good product: this did the job.
customer_reviews.text: Even though we use a very good kitty litter, we still had some odor. NonScents is the first thing I have found that makes the difference. I notice it immediately. Maybe I have an overly sensitive sniffer but I was always a bit bothered by the litter box (we keep it in the bathroom.) I am glad I found this product and very much recommend it. A picture of the culprit is attached--sleeping as always.
customer_reviews.author: John Paulett

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me- still stinky
customer_reviews.text: This did not work as well baking soda for me. Too expensive and seemed to do nothing to keep the odor down in the litter box. Also, the jar lid was broken on arrival and some contents were spilled. No great loss, tho. Save the money and buy either a can of Febreeze or some baking soda. Both much cheaper and more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Pat mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Bomb Diffuser in a Bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Man I've only been using this for a week and this stuff rocks!!! Id been using baking soda and activated charcoal granules in the litter for a while, scooping daily and dumping entirely once a week for one cat. I have a ridiculously heightened sense of smell, so I could still detect the faintest smell of a litter box in our bedroom some days. This stuff is awesome! And it seems to go a decent ways too- no cat smell whatsoever. Our cat is a sphynx, which are well known for their insane ability to create the stinkiest of poohs. No more coming home to a stinky box after work! I'll be buying this by the 50lb bag!
customer_reviews.author: Ketta Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great on eliminating the smell
customer_reviews.text: Although each cat and each family has its own story, but I definitely recommend every cat-adopter at least to try this product and see how it works for you. But it's working very great for me. I kept trying different odor control but none of them working really wonderful and I had to hold my breath when scooping (they worked, but not great enough, and I'm sensitive to bad smells) until I tried this one. Again, everyone has different stories, so don't step back by its few negative review, at least try it.
customer_reviews.author: XW

customer_reviews.title: No improvement in odors for automatic litter boxes
customer_reviews.text: This really didn't have any affect on the litter smell. I have an automatic litter box that empties itself after use (thank you, technology). The litter smell isn't terrible, as a result, but I was hopeful that this would help keep the litter smelling fresh. Unfortunately, this did not reduce any odors at all - baking soda works much better. Won't repurchase, though it may work for the typical standing litter boxes.
customer_reviews.author: GottaLoveBooks

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not overly impressed. We clean his box whenever we see him go in to use it. Litter box still stinks and I have had to leave the vent in the bathroom on. The only thing that has changed is the poor kitten drags my kids socks into his litter box to try to cover the strong smell this stuff leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Llr

customer_reviews.title: 100% works
customer_reviews.text: We have one cat, and she has two litter trays placed in a corner of our small laundry room in the basement. I needed something to eradicate odor buildup when I'm unable to change the litters that week. I tried baking powder, pet air fresheners and scented liners but this works THE BEST. The granules smell like chlorine in a swimming pool, but once in the litter no scent in apparent. Definitely advised to scoop the poor regularly to extend the life of the litter and the product. Will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sharp Family

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough one. The pros this absolutely eliminates odor, easy to use, easy to store, don’t need a lot to benefit from it. The cons something in here to eliminate odors really as a strong smell like bleach or significant cleaning like agent. I (an adult) clean the cat box in our house and this is one product that I would never allow my kids to use. I’m now not using it as I’m concerned with my eyes watering, coughing after and seriously what could this be doing to our cats. For me I will continue to scoop once a day and skip this.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: Smells Chemicals, Gritty Texture, Mystery Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on my cat box; but I don't like the way it clumps up when it gets wet from urine. It has a granular, sandy texture. I asked the seller what the ingredients are, because the cheimcal smell concerned me, but didn't get an answer. I've seen that other people have also asked this question, and just gotten a patented ingredient type answer. Better safe than sorry. This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaB

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about using this product it first because of the reviews in regards to the bleach smell and the protection of my cats. I have use this product for over six months and have not had any issues with my cats or myself. The more you use it the Freshir your litter smells. It does have a bleach smell but it’s not overpowering and it makes the litter box cleaning a lot easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M

customer_reviews.title: An Antidote to My Cat’s Powerful Magic
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well. My cat is thoroughly litter box trained (bless her!), but her aroma is sometimes quite strong. A few sprinkles of Nonscents, and the odor is gone. The product leaves a bit of a bleach odor immediately after use, but that dissipates fairly quickly (and usually only occurs when I have been a bit neglectful in my litter box maintenance duties). It’s well-packaged and easy to store and apply—just hold the container at arm’s length and give it a couple of salt shaker moves above the litter box—voila! This is a great way to keep the litter box tolerable between major cleanings and replacements.
customer_reviews.author: William Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Powdered chlorine, doubt it is truly safe
customer_reviews.text: This is simply powdered chlorine. While it does minimize odor, temporarily, so would sousing the litter with pool chlorine tablets. This stuff burns the eyes while pouring into litter boxes...far worse that that fantastic cat urine ammonia waft, I seriously doubt this is safe to put directly in litter. I use the Breeze Box, so I put it on the absorbent pad, but still do not feel like I am doing well by the furballs. I don’t even give them the highly-chlorinated water than runs from the tap down here in the Swamplands.
customer_reviews.author: TropicalDepression23

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this now for over 2 years for my kitty, and I absolutely love it! For one, the customer service is always unbeatable; when I order, receive my order, and a few weeks after my delivery I receive customer support emails from their team. Using a sprinkle of this with my regular litter box cleaning allows me to go from cleaning every day to every 3-4 days for my single cat, and its light scent (like a simple & clear laundry detergent) reduces odors. This is a powder/small granule form that is not dusty, which is important for my cat's chronic respiratory issues. I will keep using this for as long as I have cats!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Joy Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Some kind of sorcery
customer_reviews.text: Honestly shocked! I have no idea what in this magical concoction, but I’m sold! I was skeptical at first because I’ve tried everything to eliminate odor from the cat box room. We have 3 cats and two litter boxes, I do a full change every 3-4 days, and usually by the 4th day my whole room is starting to smell of urine. I am on day 5 (testing to see how long odor will be curbed) and there is literally no smell at all! I will continue to buy this product until I don’t have cats!!
customer_reviews.author: Mickelos G.

customer_reviews.title: 3 kitties, NO SMELL!!
customer_reviews.text: Yay!! No litter box smell! I currently have my cats’ litter box in my bedroom. With 3 kitties, I scoop it daily but it still gets really smelly really quickly! I didn’t want something to cover up the smell, no perfume, and nothing that would offend my girls and make them avoid the litter box and go pee somewhere they shouldn’t. Upon opening this product had a faint smell of bleach, like Lysol wipes, so I was a bit apprehensive. I sprinkled it in the litter and holy moly! No SMELL! No smell from the product, no litter box smell, nothing. My kitties don’t seem to notice it’s in the litter. I’m very happy!
customer_reviews.author: G. Crago

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat box (Scoopfree electric one) for two cats. It's great! Since I don't change the litter until after 2 weeks, sometimes the odor is off putting. I sprinkle this deodorizer when needed and it keeps the odors at bay, which does extend the life of the crystal litter. Although it's not a big container, the deodorizer goes a long way. One lasts me about a month which is what I expect. Besides the fact that it does cut down on the odors, the best thing is that it doesn't mask it with flowery or unpleasant fragrances. There is no smell at all! I've tried baking soda, etc. and this beats all of them. Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: This made my cat pretty sick
customer_reviews.text: My cat developed a respiratory problem a couple of days after I sprinkled this stuff on his litter. It should've been obvious that it's not exactly safe for cats based on it smelling like an overly-chlorinated, public swimming pool. I took him to the vet, and luckily all of his lab work was fine. He's never outside or around other animals, so the only real culprit was this crap. Once I put in new litter without this junk in it, his sneeze/wheezing issues went away completely. I have no idea how this stuff gets such rave reviews!
customer_reviews.author: C842

customer_reviews.title: No more odor!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best thing ever! I love my cats, but I hate the litter box and the smell! I have tried multiple different cat litters, I frequently clean the box (sanitize) and still that smell! Until now! I just clean the box and sprinkle this on the fresh litter. I can also use it in between cleaning to maintain an ammonia free area. May smell like a swimming pool, but definitely beats what the box usually smells like. I will keep this on hand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Jentoft

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My mind is officially blown! I don’t have a clue how this product works, but it WORKS! I don’t even care how it works. IT WORKS! I have a super sensitive nose. Obnoxiously sensitive. I can smell bacteria a mile away. It’s so annoying. You can only imagine how I can smell a kitty cat box. Well, not anymore! I’m over the moon. Beyond happy. Elated! I have suggested this product to every kitty cat owner that I know.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pechacek

customer_reviews.title: wow WOW! It works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is seriously magic! (I'm sure it's science.) I can't believe I hadn't found this product sooner. I foster cats for a rescue and we usually have 1-3 cats at a time. Sometimes we are nursing cats to better health that have different ailments and deal with kitties with very stinky stool and diarrhea. This stuff significantly diminishes odors coming from the litter box. This product has a slight bleach smell which I don't mind at all (especially if the alternative is poop smell). We usually use World's Best Cat Litter in lavender scent; so this product pairs nicely with that to keep bad smells under control. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ALM

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this product did not work for my two kitties. I applied the recommended amount but it effected the way the litter absorbed waste. Found it less clumpy and harder to scoop clean. I also didn’t like the chemical smell it had. Kind of made me nervous to breathe it in or have my sweet kitties in it. I can not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Apsara

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and a terrible waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I had a very high expectations for this product give them the reviews on Amazon however, upon using it for two months, I have found it not to be helpful that all in reducing the litter box odor. I’m terribly disappointed giving that I had spent $65 for the large bag. I gave it a fair shot. People do not waste your money on this product. I’m going to try first steps Crystal litter deodorizer and see how that goes. Because I have a house full of cats and Foster’s, I wanted to give this a try. Litter box orders are always a challenge in any household with cats.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER S. ITO

customer_reviews.title: Miraculously eliminated litter stink!!
customer_reviews.text: I was scooping 1-2 times a day for one cat and using ozone machine which isn’t good for our lungs and my laundry room still smelled terrible! This stuff is miraculous! Now I never run ozone, scoop every couple days, sprinkle a small amount of this on after scooping and NO stink! I’ve been using for several months, kitty doesn’t seem to care. It’s not cheap but one jar lasted for months. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie T

customer_reviews.title: Works but not great
customer_reviews.text: I keep renting this but I'm not sure it works as well as I'd hoped. The smell is like a VERY faint ozone scent so not unpleasant and it does seem to eliminate cat box odors in the moment. It isn't long lasting. Or maybe I'm not using enough? I use unscented litter though since cats have a better sense of smell and don't enjoy perfume type smells as much as I do and the litterbox is necessary for my indoor-only cats so I don't want them to be uncomfortable. I'll keep buying this because it doesn't bother my two furry family members and it does work, just not great.
customer_reviews.author: GigiJenny

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: Well, if you get this, don't expect it to keep your litter smelling "fresh." It's a fairly pricy option for using it often, and frankly, I prefer something with a bit of fragrance in order to counter the "litter box smell" that results from using fragrance-free litter. This product has a bit of a bleach-like smell, and honestly, unless I was just putting it over the litter, it didn't seem to make a notable difference in the freshness of the litter box. So, if you want to sprinkle something in every time you scoop to cover the newest odors, I guess this might work for you. Me, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: KSHTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Active ingredient is zeolite
customer_reviews.text: Zeolite does absorb smells you can google videos on youtube about it. Zeolite and activated charcoal removes smells. Activated baking soda will also do the same. I have both in my kitty litter box so it absorbs the smells of the cat. That pee and poop is smelly. I highly recommend zeolite and activated charcoal. Those two combine should trap most of the horrible smell. For all the people with native reviews. Your supposed to sprinkle it with your regular cat litter. Even better just buy a lot of zeolite and mix with activated baking soda litter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chan

customer_reviews.title: NonScents Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 very sweet, loving rescued cats raised since kittens (2 are smaller and 2 are much larger), and keep them indoors since I live in the country & keep them safe inside from outside predators like hawks, and other predatory animals. So, no going outside to potty for any of them! This product really works. I keep two very large cat boxes with high sides in my laundry area. I've been very pleased since using NonScents that I don't notice the urine smell at times like before having used other scented baking soda products. I still continue changing/cleaning the boxes on a regular basis, too. But, what a refreshing difference now! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the nonscents carpet deodorizer-- which worked wonders to get the stink out of a carpet that had been peed on multiple times-- but even though the carpet was no longer smelling, the litter box was. We were recently able to switch to an unscented litter with no stinky pee smell anymore thanks to this stuff. I used to come home and walk downstairs and wonder where the smell was coming from-- did she pee on the rug? Was it a stinky box? It's such a relief to not deal with that anymore. Great product line.
customer_reviews.author: Noneya

customer_reviews.title: I finally found a product that works!
customer_reviews.text: For the last couple of years I've been using non scented litter because one of my cats will not use the litter box if I use a scented product. So I decided to try this to eliminate the smell. I had been using baking soda but it just causes even more of a problem with dust. This product really helps with the odor. I'm recommending this to my daughter who has four cats. It is very easy to use by just sprinkling on the top after cleaning the waste out of the litter box. Thank you for making this project available on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: I don't know HOW, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. We have three cats, and two have IBD, which means they sometimes have loose, smelly stool that stink up the box (and the house) even after you clean it. This product has an "unodor" - you can smell it, but it just smells "clean," without having a particular scent to attribute to it. It absolutely makes a litter box smell better, but please, you STILL need to regularly scoop your litter! This is for lingering odors, not to make up for a pet owner's poor litter maintenance! I'm still on the same bottle, but I plan to keep buying this!
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: "Swimming pool" smell yes; freshening litter NO.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 young cats who pee and poop alot! With 4 litter boxes I scoop minimally at morning, noon, and dinner, this DID make the litter smell like a "swimming pool".........mixed with litter box smell. I used it as directed....started with a fresh box, lined the bottom then sprinkled on top and with cleanings, etc.....did not work for me. I'm reverting back to Arm n Hammer .....I can use barely a thimble full of that and the litter is actually FRESH. This product just wasn't for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates Catbox Odors Completely!
customer_reviews.text: I went to war with my catbox 2 months ago after it was forever musty and stinky regardless of what room we put it in, and this was the magic solution to make our box 100% undetectable! It's amazing. You can legit not smell our catbox at all anymore after we started using this and a charcoal filter on top. I really love that it's also safe, natural and a family business. 100% try it for an invisible catbox- it's a miracle solution
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Smell worse/clumping liter not clumped
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this no stars I would in RED!! This stuff is supposed to take care of ammonia smell but it was worse and the clumping liter I have used for years did NOT clump! I will NOT RECOMMEND OR BUY AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: MAM721

customer_reviews.title: The best I have ever tried
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kitty litter deodorant I have ever used. Having two kitty litter boxes and one Kitty, I allowed one box to become extremely stinky so that I could put this to the test. I can only say that it exceeded my expectations. I gave it a 1 star for the scent because there was no scent at call. I used scent free kitty litter and was totally surprised that there was no smell at all. Although this is currently out of stock, I will purchase it again as soon as it is available.
customer_reviews.author: WVgal

customer_reviews.title: It works! My cat doesn't notice.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give it a try despite SOME reviews saying it didn't work. I love it! I sprinkle a bit over the litter after scooping, add a bit more litter & it really does eliminate odors. Of course, IF the cat poops right afterward, there is a slight odor but the acrid urine smell is gone! Some mentioned it isn't odorless as advertised. Out of the container there IS a chlorine smell but not when you apply it. My cat doesn't seem to react to it at all either (I was a bit concerned)...uses her litter as if it wasn't there. Pheww!!🤣
customer_reviews.author: NY Rose

customer_reviews.title: It's SO much better than expected!! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: With each passing day, I love this more and more! I wasn't sure what to expect when I ordered it, and now I'm ecstatically surprised! It has a slight scent that is pleasant and not overwhelming. I was worried about our kitty not liking it, but she doesn't seem affected. We clean her box at least once per day, sometimes twice. I let it go for two days to test the product and the is no litter odor at all. We will definitely be buying more NonScents Cat Litter Deodorizer! 😻
customer_reviews.author: T Pickett

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SAUCE
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! I am so happy to have found this litter deodorizer. It works better than anything I've ever tried. Better than litter alone, baking soda, arm and hammer products, glade products, etc. When you first sprinkle it on, it smells a bit like a chlorinated pool to me, but that scent goes away pretty quickly, leaving NO SCENT behind! The liquid spray version works just as well for things like curtains, bedding, and kennel areas. I love it so much I should really buy stock in it.
customer_reviews.author: college cate

customer_reviews.title: Helps tamp down the “stinkies”
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help control odors from three litter boxes that are particularly offensive in humid weather. I have other products but they are sprays that just make the litter even heavier in summer. I do scoop multiple times a day. It all helps but the smell from used litter still wafts. Well this is the final piece of the puzzle. I use daily (and maybe twice) and now no one smells kitty odors even at the top of the basement stairs. Yay! Yes, like others I’ve detected a chlorine-like scent but it seems to dispel and the cats aren’t bothered. I win!
customer_reviews.author: TheJackster

customer_reviews.title: Wow! It *really* works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim when I adopted my kitten. Since we live in a rather small space I was worried about managing the smell of the litter box. I just sprinkle some of this on the litter after I scoop and it really helps hide the smell. He even had a parasitic problem which made his bowel movements smell terrible. This honestly helped with that so much it's pretty unbelievable. I've tried other products in this past, but this by far has been the most effective. I will definitely be purchasing this again. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: The Odor is Gone!
customer_reviews.text: How well does this deodorizer work? I had a friend come to the house and after being there for a couple of hours, she noticed the litter box. And she said to me, "I didn't know you had a cat." She then went on to say that usually you can smell the litter box when you walk into someone's home where they have a cat. In the case of my house, she didn't smell anything. So this deodorizer works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Page

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I only do reviews for products that really amaze me. This is one of those products. My daughter received two kittens for her birthday. After only a few days, I thought it wasn't going to work out due to the stench from their litter box. It was sickening. This stuff is amazing. Completely eliminates the litter box odor. It smells like we live in a pet free home but we have two awesome cats!! I do recommend using Fresh Step litter in conjunction with the deodorizer for completely destroying foul litter odors.
customer_reviews.author: Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I live in a small mostly rural community outside of Boise ID. It also happens to be a convenient dumping ground for cats/kittens. We adopted 3 kittens and the mom cat all of which are indoor/outdoor cats, however, they like their litter boxes (2 very large) a lot! This NonScents Deodorizer really does work. Even though the litter boxes are cleaned regularly, the litter still smells a bit. I tried this product and found that it kills any odor left in the box and, as a leave in product, continues to control cat odor. The wonderful thing is that the deodorizer has no scent of its own so there's no perfumy odor wafting through the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D.

customer_reviews.title: No more stink!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and the smell of their box is terrible even with frequent changing of the litter. I've tried clay, wheat, newspaper and many more different kinds of litter and nothing really helped. You knew we had cats as soon as you walked into the house. I gave NonScents a try and amazingly this stuff works! I was worried the cats would reject their box with the new additives but they don't seem to notice it. It's a wonder product and kills the smell without masking it with a new odor. The smell just disappears!
customer_reviews.author: Mtn Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not overly impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to review because it just depends on your cat and your scooping routine. I can say at first I was surprised at how small the container was. It was as described, but I guess I just expected that amount to be bigger. That's on me. It was hard to know how much to use, so I tried both large and smaller amounts. I don't think it made much of a difference. For the price, I'm not sure if I would try again.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten SH

customer_reviews.title: Might be harmful to lungs!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that when sprinkling this into the cat box, I would feel some irritation in my chest/lungs and found myself coughing. A look at the ingredients shows one of its contents is a trademarked ingredient made up of "biodegradable chlorine-based deodorizer". Here's what I found online: "chlorine is poisonous and swallowing or inhaling it can cause harm. Chlorine poisoning is a medical emergency." This can't be good for you. Yikes!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Persnickety

customer_reviews.title: Strong scent, decent at masking odor
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a bleach/chlorine smell. The more I use the stronger it gets, but my older kitty has THE smelliest poop, and this seems to mask it at least. I honestly cant determine if it absorbs any smells. You only need a little sprinkle on the top, don't even have to mix it in. A good odor absorbing litter is probably the better route than additives. I'll keep using this and maybe buy again once I determine how long it will last me, just to help with the PEYEEWWW! 😂
customer_reviews.author: TanL

customer_reviews.title: Harmed my cat’s skin and cost me a pretty penny
customer_reviews.text: My cat developed a rash on her belly shortly after putting this in her litter box. She had never had skin issues before which led me to taking her to the vet several times, getting bloodwork done, and purchasing various medications and ointments to help.... close to $300 later, the rash is gone after I realized that this could be the cause and stopped putting it in her litter box... buyer (and kitty) beware
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L

customer_reviews.title: The best odor eliminator I know
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this is the best cat litter odor eliminator I've ever known - and I looked everywhere. Works like magic, instantly. And you need just a little sprinkle. Smells very clean without any perfume. I'm on my second bottle - the first one lasted me almost a year (!!!) - with multiple cats family. Wow! Hope this seller will be on the market forever. It just can't be any better.
customer_reviews.author: kigi

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to explain the smell of this product. Let's see, have you ever smelled nothing? Okay, that's the smell, nothing. After sprinkling a little in the box and walk away and you smell nothing. the product smells like nothing and your litter box will smell like nothing. I have 3 cats with 3 separate litter boxes and those boxes are all in my laundry room. If you walk into my laundry toom you won't notice I have litter boxes unless I tell you
customer_reviews.author: Jewel62014

customer_reviews.title: This stuff canNOT be healthy for you or your pet
customer_reviews.text: It smells like bleach when you first use it but as it mixes in-between litter changes the smell is absolutely terrible. It gave me headaches constantly and I initially thought it was the litter brand until I changed that and the smell was still there. If you have young children and/or live in a smaller home- DO NOT purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: It really does work.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about a month now. It really does work. A few sprinkles after each litter box cleaning. I did notice the bleachy smell everyone mentioned but it's better than the alternative of a stinky box. A few sprinkles is all it needs after a litter box cleaning. I don't mind it and it goes away. But, I can honestly say I can't tell when my cat uses the litter box anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Glenis

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and works as advertised. I didn't find any odors from this and my cats didn't have any issues using the litter box after I had sprinkled this on top of the litter. I use this for my Robot litter in conjunction with the NonScent spray and there is no smell. I work from home and have my litter box in my office. I don't smell the litter box from 2 ft away with these two products, which I am very grateful for. I used to smell it in the hallway in front of my office, now I don't even smell it in my office!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and immediately sprinkled it over the litter. I foster kittens and they can be stinky and messy in their box. I have a small house so the smell wherever the litter box was takes over not just one room but all the way down the hall. After applying, the smell of the litter was almost instantly gone! I haven’t had to deal with the smell all day! I don’t know what I was doing before I had this stuff... absolute must for anyone with a litter box!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: A big help
customer_reviews.text: This product is so different than the strongly scented products I've used in the past. In and of itself, it doesn't smell great...sort of like an indoor pool smell. But once I mix it in with the litter, there is no smell. And it seems to neutralize the odors from the cats using the litter box so much better than other products. (especially since i have one cat who doesn't always cover her business!) This is the product I'll stick with from now on. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: YOU MUST BUY THIS IF YOU HAVE CATS!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing works any better than this product for a cat litter box. I highly recommend and have told so many people about this product. I will continue to buy this product and pray it never goes away. I have to large Maine Coon cats and when I have ran out at Discover house valuable this product is not only for my cat but for us humans who live in the house with them. You must check out this product I highly recommend it..
customer_reviews.author: Pamela D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 6 stars I would! I have to keep two cat boxes in a spare bedroom and I would smell them daily. It didn't matter how much I cleaned them or changed with a litter I could still smell them. I tried this yesterday and sprinkled a little in each Box. Zero smell now! I awoke this morning to no smell in my house. I highly recommend this product and will continue buying it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Helene

customer_reviews.title: Works great but not enough product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried so many odor neutralizers for that foul litter box smell and nothing works as quick and as well as this product. It has a couple of drawbacks though. It only controls the odor for a couple of days and you have to use a lot of the product to see any effects. I have a litter robot so I have to basically shake it about five times. I’ve only used it twice and I only have about 75% of the product left.
customer_reviews.author: Edg

customer_reviews.title: A total lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I sprinkle a little of this twice a week on top of my cat's litter (clean the box totally once a week and do daily scooping in between) but it really does help cut back on some of the nasties. I love how fine the granules are because I've bought carbon crystals before, and while both products did the same job my cats seem to tolerate this better because it blends into their litter more and doesn't poke their feet like the carbon crystals. Each can lasts me about 2 months and you can notice an immediate difference if you sprinkle on used litter.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: It definitely works! I rescued a stray cat, ...
customer_reviews.text: It definitely works! I rescued a stray cat, who has really vile smelling pee and feces. When I say vile I mean vile. I sprinkled it generously over her litter and smell disappeared within minutes. I give it 3 stars because it's highly overpriced! It's 100% zeolite so I ordered a 20 Lbs bag of coop freshener (made of 100% zeolite) and had exact the same effect. The 20 Lbs bag cost me $17!
customer_reviews.author: roksana boyes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This product is incredible I have two cats that share one litter box and the smell was unbearable. One of my cats has asthma very bad so I cannot use later that has Fragrance or dust. And that leaves me with a very stinky litter box even though we clean it daily I bought this product sprinkled on top over a week ago and I still have no odor coming from whatsoever. I just wish I had found this sooner thank you for this wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene E Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Smelly cat..smelly cat...
customer_reviews.text: Let me start this by saying I've gone through every type of litter, food, and "de-odorizer" out there, had vet visits...everything....and my kitty has some seriously smelly poop still. I had given up... We could be READY with a poop scoop as soon as she finished but her litter box smelled regardless. This is life changing. Amazing and there's no scent that just masks it with alcoholic perfume. It is mind blowing.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: A lifesaver. The cats became allergic to any unscented litter that contains activated charcoal (which keeps the smell down), so we were left with purely unscented litter that had no way of not smelling. Unfortunately, the litter box is located in a closet right next to my desk, and this made things rather unpleasant. We bought NonScents and things smell no more! There is no smell, zilch, coming from the litter box, and I do consider myself someone who can (unfortunately) smell everything. It's wonderful. The product does have a vague chlorine/bleach smell itself, but only when you initially put it on, then it goes away quickly. It doesn't bother me or the cats. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried A LOT of different products for the litter box with varying degrees of success, but, NonScents actually does what it says it does~takes away the odor. Woot!! I scoop and sprinkle 2-3x a day and you wouldn't even guess I have cats :) I was standing in the laundry room with my next door neighbor and you could see the box had been used and I asked if she smelled anything and the answer was, 'No.' Then she went and ordered some NonScents for herself. Great product~at any price!
customer_reviews.author: IvanaYvonne

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Makes the litter last longer for sure. I have one special little 15 year-old kitty who is very particular about her litterbox being clean. I scoop at least 2 times a day but if it gets even a little dirty, she hesitates to use it - opting to wait until I clean it. This product works great - makes the litter last longer before needing to be replaced. And it's the only thing I've found that doesn't make her sneeze from the smell. She has terrible allergies so I have to be careful about that. I have it on auto-delivery and intend to keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Gal

customer_reviews.title: Smells like bleach
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like the smell. Smells like bleach. My cats didn’t like it either. They circled the litter box checking it out. The cats would not go into the box until I added another layer of litter. So now that’s what I do. It does work for the cat odors but don’t forget your adding a bleach odor. The bleach odor does get less potent by the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stuff
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 lovely cats that use 2 litter boxes. Even emptying them everyday they still smelled more than I wanted. We changed litter types with no change. We tried this after not knowing what else to do. It works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my kitties
customer_reviews.text: Good communication/follow-up from seller. Most important product works. Only downside I can speak of, very, very expensive. I work with a cat rescue, would love to keep using product for the rescue & our fosters, just too expensive as we are not for profit. Dr. Jeff, thank you for great product. If you have any interest in quarterly product sponsorship, please, please reply. Would love to help spread word about your product. Best way I can do that, use in the rescue and with fosters. Thanking you in advance for your consideration. Hope to hear from you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST EVER!!!!  This is NOT "Fragrance Free" - IT STINKS of CHLORINE!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was SO happy to get this item. HOWEVER - When I opened it and SMELLED it - there was a VERY VERY VERY STRONG ODOR of CHLORINE!!!!! It burned **MY** NOSE and EYES!!!!!!! I cannot imagine what it would have done to my kitty!!!!!!!!!!!! HORRIBLE - SHAME on these people! Are they TRYING to kill or maim all the cats this is used by?????????
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: No more El Stinko odors!
customer_reviews.text: This product delivers! We are very pleased with this product. And the mews don't seem to mind it. Our next venture is clumping litter! One thing we should warn you about is: Do not have the litter box in the bathroom when you shower, especially with hot water. For some reason the steam seems to activate the Nonscents in a very pungent manner. And it is quite unpleasant. Also make sure you let the bathroom air out before you place the litterbox back in there.
customer_reviews.author: CCluvs2shop

customer_reviews.title: Works great for multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: With four cats in our house, litter smell is a big deal. Using this product has greatly extended the life of out litter and made our house smell cleaner. We do a sprinkle over the top of the litter when we change the box, then any time we notice the smell start becoming too much to handle, and it has nearly doubled the life of the litter, saving us time and money
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like this but just not as good as other brands
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of this product but unfortunately it just didn't work out for me. The product itself smells very much like bleach which was offputting. I found I had to add a lot of product so value for the money wasn't good. I also didn't find it as effective as the Arm & Hammer cat litter box deodorizer. I won't be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Boessler

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing, but has a slight bleach smell
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing and really works, it's the only litter deodorizer I've found that actually eliminates the smells. I swear what comes out of my cat comes straight from the fiery depths of hell and it smells HORRIBLE. It also stinks up the entire two floors of the house, there is no escaping the smell. But nonscents has changed that for me, I can finally breathe again. The only downside to it is that is has a slight bleachy scent to it but honestly I'd prefer that over his litter box smells. But seriously, this stuff is life changing.
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST THING EVER
customer_reviews.text: A game changer. I have three 3 cats and been stuck with one big liter box in the kitchen. Even with scooping every day and fresh liter regularly, it was impossible to not stink sometimes. Especially those extra icky poos... you know what I’m talking about ... and omg .., in the KITCHEN?? But THIS!?!?! Seriously. Total. Game changer. I will never go without. (I’ve also tried a zillion kinds of liter. I’m now sticking with Elsey. For me, these two products make liter a breeze.)
customer_reviews.author: PeggyP

customer_reviews.title: No effect
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was working but I was using it with very clean fresh litter boxes and learned that this product does very little to further reduce odor. My tidy cats red lid does the job just fine without wasting money on this stuff. Better solution is to just keep up with the complete dumping and disinfecting of your litter boxes. If the litter stinks don't be lazy and try to cover it up, just dump, disinfect and change.
customer_reviews.author: E.I.

customer_reviews.title: Odorless and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Just as is advertised, this product has no real detectable scent. The cats appreciate it to freshen the litter box between the time when all the litter is replaced (monthly). I'm glad I found this since other products tend to come scented but they also make my entire apartment smell the same as the litter box (which is unappealing!). I'd really rather have people be unaware that I have cats until they see them rather than have it seem like I'm trying hard to cover up odors... especially since I'm consistent about keeping my cats scooped & their boxes fresh and clean
customer_reviews.author: HGrace

customer_reviews.title: Kinda pricey but it prolongs your cat liter
customer_reviews.text: Love this and I wish I could give it 4.5 stars because it actually does work BUT it’s a pricey luxury item you don’t necessarily NEED. That being said, it also does prolong your cat liter (esp crystals) so it kinda goes hand in hand. It’s obviously not a miracle worker and won’t eliminate all scents completely but it does a decent job at reducing existing scents. It does have an odor (kinda like Clorox) so if you’re sensitive to scents, keep that in mind. Doesn’t bother me, but I’m fine with scented items. Other than that, this is great. I like it, my cat likes it, and it does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: Manages Litter Odor with Weird Smell
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this and so far, it seems to be managing the overwhelming smell a bit better than the last product we used. It definitely comes with a slightly off-putting odor of its own, but that weird smell is a little easier to cope with than the smell of cat poo. This product was a bit expensive IMO, but if it works well then I guess it'll be worth it. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: asleepby9

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no odor!!
customer_reviews.text: I L.O.V.E. this product!! I live in a cute but small apartment in the city and have an indoor cat and this is the 1st product ever in a 1.5yr that actually works. My friends tell me you absolutely cannot tell that I have a cat living in the apartment. I turned one of my friends who has 2 cats onto the product and she's impressed with it too. We both agree that baking soda isnt sufficient enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kikanai

customer_reviews.title: O..M..G!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 girls who don't even bother to cover their poo, and one boy who does but it barely makes a difference because his poo stinks to high heaven!! I just received this today, and my boy took his signature smelly dump so I sprinkled a little in the box and VOILA! Instantaneous difference!! The smell was GONE as soon as it hit the litter!! My mind is blown! I've been using the arm and hammer litter powder but it makes the litter too dusty and just masks the smell with flowery fragrance,it also takes a while to work. I'm in love with this and amazed!! I love that it looks and feels just like litter too!!
customer_reviews.author: LiZee

customer_reviews.title: An unintended experiment.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! . . . I unintentionally conducted an experiment on how well this works by running out of it and failing to buy a new container. My spouse and I both noticed a distinct change coming from the litter box area. What was previously an area that went unnoticed now became a source of periodic and lingering stinky smell. Time to buy more, and 2 bottles this time! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly effective
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised at how effective this is at blocking odors. I have some VERY stinky cats, like hot coffee + garbage that's been sitting in the sun stinky. I sprinkle some of this on and the smell is instantly gone. It does leave a very slight chlorine smell (it has a chlorine coating), but it doesn't make the room smell like a pool. Because of the chlorine, my cats are obsessed with it and will roll around in it if I get any on the floor, so I just have to be careful with it.
customer_reviews.author: Avery T

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye smelly cat
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but holy (I smell no more!) crap this really helps! I have 3 cats and only 1200sq ft, not ideal, and have for years searched for products to help. So much money spent on different litters, plug ins, sprays, and gel deodorizers but no more! NonScents works like a charm, doesn’t have an aggressive smell or simply mask the smell, it actually helps freshen the box. Picky kitties had no problem with this added to their box! I’ve set up a reaccuring order save yourself the stress and do the same!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Powder Bleach for cats
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god. This smells like straight up hair bleach. At first its just a little slight chlorine smell but when your kitty pees all hell breaks loose. As a person who personally bleached their own hair before this smells like straight up bleach. I can’t stand the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Two cats, one apartment
customer_reviews.text: This product does eliminate odor. I've been using it for several months now and it's worked well. I have two cats and live in an apartment building. I'm constantly maintaining their litter box due to my living arrangement. I sprinkle some of the product on the litter prior to leaving for work and I don't come home to a litter box smell. It is very dusty which is my only negative comment on this product
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job--for a price
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. After getting a second cat I find the odor of two litter boxes is not the same as one box doubled. More like the smell of an entire zoo--plus two litter boxes. Well, this stuff really does work. It's also good for sprinkling on top of apple pie--just kidding. If you use a container to accumulate the "leavings" before dumping, sprinkle a bit of NonSence on top--it destroys odor better than a boatload of baking soda. (Actually, I use both.) The downside? Cost.
customer_reviews.author: frankly62

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: We live in a NYC apartment, which = small. As diligent as we are in scooping, there was a scent. Changing out and scrubbing the litter box twice a week was getting expensive, because good litter ain’t cheap. This stuff has been an absolute miracle. If you’re on top of cleaning the litter and you don’t let that sh*t (or pee) sit, using this makes it seem like there’s no litter box in the house. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: SS71

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.text: My friend asked me to order this product for her because her sister didn't want to house sit her two dogs and cat because of the smell of the kitty liter. We searched on Amazon for an appropriate product and decided to give NonScents a try. My friend swears it works so well that it is a miracle and her sister can now tolerate coming over to housesit. She already asked me to order another jar for her so she can keep it on hand. I would say this product lives up to its claims and it a winner!
customer_reviews.author: C. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work and cat doesn’t mind
customer_reviews.text: I bought Nonscents to help out with a cat litter I use that is less dusty than most clumping types, but this sacrifices on odor control and since my litter box is in a litter box furniture container in my living room, odor control and low litter dust is crucial. It seems to help, I’ve been sprinkling in with each day cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney B.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will 100% !
customer_reviews.text: These granules are amazing! This is an awesome product that does exactly what it says it will . Get's rid of cat urine odor with a very small amount, just lightly sprinkled it on top of litter after I'd cleaned the litter pan. There is a very slight bleach odor that isn't bad at all but, that's it ! I am amazed ! Long time user of Arm and Hammer litter box powder , it's a great product , but this stuff outperforms it . The only issue I have is being a private cat rescue , I cannot afford to solely use this product , but I would , if I could!
customer_reviews.author: catmama

customer_reviews.title: Odorless and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this. Love the odor control, actually snuffs out the odor instead of trying to mask it like some of the other products. No perfume smell to it at all, odorless as advertised. The only thing I don't like is that it seems to limit the clumping of the litter if you add too much to the box.
customer_reviews.author: NBurch
